articles.author: Mahmoud Harmouch
articles.description:
Welcome ğŸ‘‹!
When you're building blazingly fast WASM apps, there's one thing that silently makes or breaks the user experience: loading states. We've all been there, blank screens, layout jumps, etc. It's not just bad UX. It's lost trust.
That's why we're excited today to introduce Skeleton RS , a highly-configurable skeleton loader built natively for Rust WASM frameworks, starting with full Yew support. Think of it as a smart placeholder for your content , one that speaks fluent WASM.
Let's unpack why Skeleton RS is your new best friend when it comes to loading UIs ğŸ¦´.

Skeleton RS is a high-performance skeleton loader component designed for frontend Rust frameworks like Yew. Whether you're fetching data, lazy-loading routes, or animating components into view, Skeleton RS gives you gracefâ€¦
articles.title: ğŸ¦´ Seamless Loading with Skeleton RS

articles.description:
Hello Readers


It's day 10 of building an AI Model & I've finally progressed to a level in my AI Building Journey that it's made me convinced I can finally announce something.
I've named the model KARL-AI. The acronym, when expanded fully, acknowledges the foundation logic the model is built upon, which will be shortly introduced.
I've started the documentation for the model in parallel with coding. That should be good news, you'll get to read everything about it before watching it in action.
-
AR.
articles.title: Building AI Model

articles.author: Geampiere Jaramillo
articles.description:
When working on complex applications, especially in the backend world, keeping domain clarity and code quality is a constant challenge. That's where DDD (Domain-Driven Design) and TDD (Test-Driven Development) shine as complementary approaches. In this article, I'll show you how to combine them in a project using NestJS with modern best practices.
Domain-Driven Design is a software development philosophy that focuses on the business domain. Instead of forcing the domain to fit the code, we adapt the code to represent the domain.
Key components of DDD:
Entities: Objects with identity (e.g., a User).
Value Objects: Objects without identity, defined by their attributes (Email, Money).
Aggregates: Consistency boundaries grouping related entities.
Repositories: Abstractions for accessing aggregâ€¦
articles.title: Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD): The Perfect Duo for Robust NestJS Applications

articles.author: Zachary Huang
articles.description:
Ever felt like your program was stuck waiting... and waiting... for one API call to finish before starting the next? Especially with Large Language Models (LLMs), making multiple requests one by one can feel like watching paint dry. This guide breaks down how to drastically speed things up using parallel processing with the PocketFlow Parallel Batch Example!
Imagine you need an LLM to translate something into eight languages. The usual way?
Ask for Chinese. Wait. ğŸ˜´
Get Chinese back. Ask for Spanish. Wait. ğŸ˜´
Get Spanish back. Ask for Japanese. Wait... ğŸ˜´
... 
You see the pattern? Each "wait" adds up. This is called sequential processing. It's simple, but when you're talking to slow things like LLMs over the internet, it's painfully slow.
What if you could shout out all eight translation râ€¦
articles.title: Parallel LLM Calls from Scratch â€” Tutorial For Dummies (Using PocketFlow!)

articles.author: Mikuz
articles.description:
Introduction


The discovery of the Log4Shell vulnerability in late 2021 exposed a critical weakness in rapid software deployment practices. While DevOps has revolutionized how quickly teams can deliver software, it also revealed how security vulnerabilities can spread rapidly through automated systems. This wake-up call highlighted the essential differences between [DevOps vs DevSecOps](https://drata.com/grc-central/compliance-as-code/devops-vs-devsecops) approaches.
Traditional development methods were slow but controlled, with teams working independently before passing code to operations. DevOps solved the speed problem by integrating development and operations, but as cyber threats escalate and regulations tighten, organizations now realize that velocity alone isn't enough. Security muâ€¦
articles.title: DevOps vs DevSecOps: Evolving Software Delivery and Security

articles.author: Uriel Bitton
articles.description:
If youâ€™ve spent years building apps on relational databases, switching to DynamoDB can feel very strange.
I often tell folks to â€œforget everything you knowâ€ about relational databases.
Designing data on DynamoDB requires a very different mindset.
The biggest shift is that you donâ€™t start with your data structure, you start with your access patterns.
Understanding this concept will catapult you ahead of most folks building with DynamoDB.
Itâ€™s a mindshift from â€œwhat data do I have?â€ to â€œhow will users access my dataâ€.
Letâ€™s break this concept in this article.

In SQL, you define your schema first and normalize data into tables:
users
posts
comments
likes
shares
You then query across tables using joins to fetch the data you need. This flexibility is simultaneously SQLâ€™s strength and performanâ€¦
articles.title: How to Think in Access Patterns First With DynamoDB

articles.title: Function plot

articles.author: Will Vincent
articles.description:
After reading yet another AI hype article--this one by Kevin Roose at the New York Times gift link here--I feel compelled to respond.
Let's look at the title:

We could easily swap out "Not a Coder" with just about any profession. Not a writer? Not a doctor? Not a lawyer? Not an engineer?
The idea that you can whole swath replace an entire field or area of expertise is wrong on a number of levels. So here we go.
All the evidence we have is that current AI does not appreciate actual intelligence. See Gary Marcus's prescient take in 2022, Deep Learning is Hitting a Wall, for more on this. What has happened is that existing LLMs turn out to do really well with huge amounts of data and compute power.
It's also important to note that AI and LLMs are not synonymous, even though it is common to sâ€¦
articles.title: Thoughts on Vibe Coding

articles.author: Dib Borah
articles.description:
From Passion to Profit: Revolutionize the Pet Industry with Unconventional Services


The pet industry is booming like never before. With pet ownership at an all-time high, totaling over 67% of U.S. households, there's ample opportunity to transform your passion for pets into a lucrative business. But, with competition fierce, standing out requires innovative ideas. Ready to revolutionize the pet industry? Let's explore how unconventional services can pave your path to success.
Market Size: The U.S. pet industry reached an astonishing $103.6 billion in sales in 2020, and it continues to grow.
Humanization Trend: More people regard pets as family members, heightening demand for high-quality products and services.
The pet sector is ripe for disruption through unique services that cater not oâ€¦
articles.title: "From Passion to Profit: Revolutionize the Pet Industry with Unconventional Services"

articles.author: Thiago Souza
articles.description:
In todayâ€™s interconnected digital landscape, APIs are the backbone of modern applications. They empower innovation, enable microservices, and facilitate seamless integrations. But with this power comes a critical responsibility: ğ˜€ğ—²ğ—°ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ˜ğ˜†.
One of the most underestimated aspects of API security is ğ—½ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—ºğ—¶ğ˜€ğ˜€ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—»ğ˜€ ğ—ºğ—®ğ—»ğ—®ğ—´ğ—²ğ—ºğ—²ğ—»ğ˜. Itâ€™s not just about authentication-knowing ğ˜„ğ—µğ—¼ is calling your API-but also about ğ˜„ğ—µğ—®ğ˜ they are allowed to do. Properly implemented permissions ensure that users and systems only access the resources and operations they are authorized for, reducing the risk of data leaks and malicious actions.
As backend engineers, we must go beyond the basics. Fine-grained permissions, role-based access control (RBAC), and the principle of least privilege are essential strategies. These not only protect sensitive data but also build trust with your users and clients.
Are you confident that your APIs are granting the right permissions to the right actors? How do you handle permission updates as your system evolves? Letâ€™s share our experiences and best practices!

articles.author: Dwayne McDaniel
articles.description:
It seems every company today is excited about AI. Whether they are rolling out GitHub Copilot to help teams write boilerplate code in seconds or creating internal chatbots to answer support tickets faster than ever, Large Language Models (LLMs) have driven us into a new frontier of productivity very rapidly. Advancements like retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) have let teams plug LLMs into internal knowledge bases, making them context-aware and therefore much more helpful to the end user.
However, if you haven't gotten your secrets under control, especially those tied to your growing fleet of non-human identities (NHIs),Â AI might speed up your security incident rate, not just your team's output. Before you deploy a new LLM or connect Jira, Confluence, or your internal API docs to your inâ€¦
articles.title: Secrets Sprawl and AI: Why Your Non-Human Identities Need Attention Before You Deploy That LLM

Why finance veterans are still skeptical about blockchain            
            
                
Blockchain has been part of the finance conversation for over a decade now. Yet many professionals remain cautious.Â 
Many seasoned professionals in finance, wealth management and economics often question blockchainâ€™s relevance, asking, How exactly is blockchain supposed to fit into what we already do?

This question reflects a few key ongoing skepticisms about blockchain within finance.
Uncertainty about practical applications
Blockchain offers some big promises: faster settlements, stronger security and better transparency. But actually applying those promises across banking, accounting and operations is still complicated.
A 2021 APQC survey identified the main hurdles: a lack of industry-wâ€¦

Petr Kozyakov, CEO of crypto payments platform Mercuryo, told Cointelegraph that the future of finance may not be a winner-takes-all scenario but a blend of digital assets and fiat, each used where it makes the most sense.Â 
In a Cointelegraph interview, Kozyakov said that while crypto payments are seeing an increase in adoption and demand, the asset class wonâ€™t be fully replacing fiat money anytime soon. He said the two asset classes will coexist, with people choosing the more convenient payment option in different situations.Â 
â€œWe donâ€™t think crypto will replace fiat,â€ Kozyakov told Cointelegraph. â€œThey will coexist, and people will turn to crypto when itâ€™s the easier, more practical option, whether thatâ€™s for payroll, yield or money transfers.â€

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Simon Cain
articles.description:
Opinion by: Simon Cain, contributor at Bitcoin Policy UK
Most jurisdictions globally are researching, developing or implementing retail central bank digital currencies (CBDCs). If you see these as harmless move-with-the-times digital updates of old-fashioned paper money, look again. CBDCs potentially mean financial serfdom via a monetary panopticon where the authorities closely control every transaction.Â 
If you think this sounds paranoid, just consider the words of Augustin Carstens, head of the Bank for International Settlements â€” the central bank for the worldâ€™s central banks. Lamenting the authoritiesâ€™ current inability to control cash transactions, he says that with a CBDC, a â€œcentral bank will have absolute control on the rules and regulations that will determine use... also we will â€¦
articles.title: Bitcoin vs. digital fiat is freedom vs. serfdom

The senators called for an urgent probe, warning the deal may violate the US Constitutionâ€™s Emoluments Clause and federal bribery statutes.

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Bitcoin Core developers have decided to remove a limit on transaction data in the next network upgrade, enabling more data to be included in a more efficient way.Â 
â€œBitcoin Coreâ€™s next release will, by default, relay and mine transactions whose OP_RETURN outputs exceed 80 bytes and allow any number of these outputs,â€ read the announcement on GitHub by Bitcoin developer Greg Sanders on May 5.Â 
The long-standing limit was originally a â€œgentle signal that block space should be used sparingly for non-payment proof of publication data,â€ has outlived its utility, he added.Â 
The proposal (PR 32359) was created by Bitcoin pioneer Peter Todd at the request of Chaincode Labs.Â 
OP_RETURN is a special type of Bitcoin (BTC) transaction output that allows storing small amounts of data on the blockchain,â€¦
articles.title: Bitcoin Core to unilaterally remove controversial OP-Return limit

Lawyers acting for Mashinsky argued in a May 5 reply memorandum filed in a New York district court that he should receive no more than 366 days, because the DOJ hasn't taken into account his status as a nonviolent first-time offender with a previously unblemished 30-year history in business.Â Â

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Two Florida crypto bills have been removed from the legislative process in the latest blow to American state-level strategic Bitcoin reserve ambitions.Â 
Floridaâ€™s House Bill 487 and Senate Bill 550 have been â€œindefinitely postponed and withdrawn from considerationâ€ on May 3, according to the Florida Senate.Â 
Floridaâ€™s legislative session adjourned on May 2 without the passage of these two bills, which would have advanced legislation to establish a crypto reserve for the state. The Senate and House agreed to extend the session until June 6 to address budget plans.Â 
Lawmakers passed about 230 bills during the session, dealing with things like prohibiting putting fluoride in the water, protecting state parks, and a school smartphone ban, but diversifying state treasury portfolios was not amonâ€¦
articles.title: Florida takes strategic Bitcoin reserve bills off the table

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
A hacker who took over the Tron DAO X account is estimated to have made around $45,000 in improperly solicited funds, according to a spokesperson from Tron.Â 
Speaking to Cointelegraph, the Tron public relations team confirmed that on May 2, the Tron DAO account posted a contract address and sent direct messages to solicit payments in exchange for promotional advertising on the Tron account.
â€œOur security team quickly identified the intrusion and cut off access to the hacker, but we ask the community to continue to be vigilant. We will never ask anyone for payments like this via DM or otherwise,â€ they said.Â 
The team said that based on the illicit contract address the hacker posted, the amount improperly solicited appeared to be around $45,000.Â 
Asked whether the same hacker could be responâ€¦
articles.title: Tron says DAO X hack cost victims $45K, Curve Finance also hit

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
The Tron network has drawn closer to regaining the lead from Ethereum in Tether circulation after another big mint by the US stablecoin issuer.
On May 5, Tether minted another $1 billion Tether (USDT) on the Tron network, according to Arkham Intelligence. This brings the total USDT on Tron to $71.4 billion, according to the Tether Transparency report.Â 
In comparison, there is currently $72.8 billion USDT circulating on the Ethereum network, so just $1.4 billion more USDT on Tron will see it become the leading network for the worldâ€™s largest stablecoin issuer, as it has been previously over the last two years.Â 
Tron was ahead of Ethereum for USDT circulation between July 2022 and November 2024, but a large $18 billion mint on Ethereum pushed the network ahead again, according to CryptoQuantâ€¦
articles.title: Fresh $1B in Tether mints on Tron, closing gap again with Ethereum

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
The new â€œDigital Asset Market Structure Discussion Draftâ€ introduced by House Republicans on May 5 could work to reduce the dominance of large crypto firms and promote more participation in the broader market, according to an executive from Paradigm.Â 
The discussion draft, led by the House agricultural and financial services committee chairs Glenn Thompson and French Hill, is an â€œincremental, albeit meaningful, rewriteâ€ of the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century Act (FIT21), Paradigmâ€™s vice president of regulatory affairs Justin Slaughter said in a May 5 X post.
One-pager of the digital asset market structure discussion draft submitted by House Republicans on May 5. Source: US House Agriculture Committee

One of the major changes from FIT21 is that the draft defines anâ€¦
articles.title: New crypto bill draft seen to curb big crypto firm influence

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Jesse Coghlan
articles.description:
Samourai Walletâ€™s lawyers allege federal prosecutors suppressed advice that the firm didnâ€™t need a license before they charged executives at the crypto mixing service months later.Â 
In a May 5 letter to a Manhattan federal court, lawyers for Samourai co-founders Keonne Rodriguez and William Hill said prosecutors disclosed that the US Treasury Departmentâ€™s Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) representatives told them six months before they charged the pair â€œthat under FinCENâ€™s guidance, the Samourai Wallet app would not qualify as a â€˜Money Services Businessâ€™ requiring a FinCEN license.â€
â€œShockingly, six months later, the same prosecutors criminally charged Keonne Rodriguez and William Hill with operating just such a business without a FinCEN license,â€ the lawyers added.
The letterâ€¦
articles.title: Samourai Wallet says feds hid advice that crypto mixer was in the clear

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
Acting US Attorney for the Eastern District of New York (EDNY) John Durham has departed as President Donald Trumpâ€™s pick takes control of the office.
In a May 5 notice, the US Attorneyâ€™s Office for EDNY said Joseph Nocella will serve as interim US Attorney for the region for 120 days or until a Senate-confirmed nominee assumes the role. Nocellaâ€™s appointment came as jury selection began in the criminal trial of Braden John Karony, the former CEO of crypto firm SafeMoon.
Itâ€™s unclear how the advancement of Nocella, appointed by US President Donald Trump this month, could affect prosecutorsâ€™ case against Karony, who faces charges of securities fraud conspiracy, wire fraud conspiracy, and money laundering conspiracy. Nocella said he intended to help prosecute â€œnarcotics-traffickers, gang membâ€¦
articles.title: New York district gets interim US Attorney as ex-SafeMoon CEO trial kicks off

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex Oâ€™Donnell
articles.description:
ChatGPT-maker OpenAI has abandoned plans to become a for-profit company and reaffirmed commitment to its nonprofit status.Â 
In a May 5 blog post, OpenAI confirmed plans to convert its for-profit business unit into a so-called Public Benefit Corporation (PBC), which would remain under the nonprofitâ€™s control. PBCs are for-profit companies that are legally obligated to prioritize a social mission alongside the interests of shareholders. 
The plans mark a reversal for OpenAI, which had previously floated a for-profit conversion involving spinning out the nonprofit entity. 
â€œOpenAI was founded as a nonprofit, and is today overseen and controlled by that nonprofit. Going forward, it will continue to be overseen and controlled by that nonprofit,â€ the ChatGPT-maker said.Â 
This can be done withoutâ€¦
articles.title: OpenAI to stay nonprofit, scrap proposed overhaul

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
The Securities and Exchange Commissionâ€™s (SEC) enforcement approach on crypto firms has left a lasting â€œregulatory overhangâ€ within the industry, according to Devin Finzer, co-founder and CEO of OpenSea.Â 
Speaking to Cointelegraph, Finzer said that during Biden's administration the agency unfairly targeted good actors in the crypto space, including OpenSea. â€œThere's all sorts of digital assets, you know, you shouldn't treat them all the same. That's obvious. But I think the approach that the prior SEC was taking was kind of this, you know, very, very generic.â€
The SEC issued a Wells notice â€” a formal notification that is often a precursor to enforcement action â€” to OpenSea in 2024, alleging that the NFT marketplace was operating as an exchange for unregistered securities. At the time, Finzâ€¦
articles.title: Good actors were â€˜unfairly targetedâ€™ by SEC â€” OpenSea's CEO
